p: 10. Psychology and biology likewise overlook the being of man. Psychological and anthropological theories of human being also lack ontological foundations; nor can that be remedied by combining them into a general biology. As a “life science” biology is finally founded on the being of ex-sistence. Biology’s focus is exclusively on “life”—however, life is not something objectively present, nor is it equivalent to ex-sistence. In turn, exsistence is not some ontologically undefined “life” plus something else.
